intro: Epatitis obliqua, commonly known as the twisted liver plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. The botanical features of Epatitis obliqua make it distinctive within its native ecosystem.
